metadata.synopsis: The final section of the Companion Fates scene where the fallen characters are remembered.

72.speaker: Withers
72.text: Affairs of the heart. One one side, love. The other, grief.

20.speaker: Withers
20.text: There is one among you who is missing.

120.speaker: Withers
120.text: One whose journey has been every bit as rich as thine own.

211.speaker: Withers
211.text: One whose life shone much too brightly for this world.

22.speaker: Withers
22.text: One who made the greatest sacrifice of all.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: He saved us all, but at what cost?

158.speaker: Lae'zel
158.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

118.speaker: Jaheira
118.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
23.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

157.speaker: Astarion
157.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

216.speaker: Minsc
216.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

170.speaker: Halsin
170.text: |He did the right thing/he shouldn't have done it - whatever this companion would say about Gale blowing himself up.|

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I can't believe he did it. He actually did it.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

223.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
223.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

200.speaker: Shadowheart
200.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

63.speaker: Minsc
63.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

124.speaker: Halsin
124.text: |Poor/brave/selfless/whatever this companion would say about Gale. We owe him a debt we'll never be able to repay.|

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I hope he's at peace, wherever he is.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I thought I'd never hear the end of his ramblings.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

56.speaker: Withers
56.text: He saved many. But there was one he could not save - Karlach.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: If it wasn't for Gortash, she'd still be with us.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: |At least he got what he deserved (had his head exploded by the brain OR been killed by us directly.|

8.speaker: Withers
8.text: A sad death indeed, no less tragic for the fact that it was pre-ordained.

43.speaker: Withers
43.text: But take heart, such a spirit as she had will not be snuffed.

237.speaker: Withers
237.text: We have space enough to hold for her. And we will hold it.
237.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of fire - it flares, evoking Karlach.

86.speaker: Lae'zel
86.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

235.speaker: Shadowheart
235.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

253.speaker: Wyll
253.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

75.speaker: Halsin
75.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

233.speaker: Minsc
233.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

239.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
239.text: |May her flame burn forever bright, wherever she is.|

146.speaker: Withers
146.text: But we must hold space for one other.

178.speaker: Withers
178.text: A prince who overcame his nature to become the thing he most despised.

156.speaker: Withers
156.text: A prince who sacrified all that he was, all that he stood for, all to save his people.

161.speaker: Lae'zel
161.text: |His death was honourable. And yet - I mourn him still.|

185.speaker: Withers
185.text: True heroes do not die in death.

28.speaker: Withers
28.text: Though thou may mourn his mortal passing, his legacy lives on.

59.speaker: Withers
59.text: It is forever written in past, present - and future.

111.speaker: Withers
111.text: In his people. In his home.
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pan up to stars - a comet if we can.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

197.speaker: Gale
197.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

39.speaker: Jaheira
39.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

241.speaker: Minsc
241.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

188.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
188.text: |A shame to have lost the princebut better to die a hero than live a monster|

215.context: CinematicNodeContext: A rustle of sound in nearby shrubbery. Companions look around, suspicious. Perhaps one reaches for a weapon. A mind flayer steps into the firelight.

112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind flayer joins the campfire.

143.speaker: Lae'zel
143.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

203.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind flayer starts a mind meld with the gathered group. No tadpoles anymore, but relying on a shared sense of hivemind created by having survived this adventure together. Stills/artwork rather than fully animated scenes.

9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flashback/shared vision: We see the mind flayer having retreated into the shadows of the city (like the Emperor did in his INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus flashback).

180.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the mind flayer consuming the minds of criminals (like the Emperor did).

133.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the mind flayer doing a good deed. Reuse anim MFL_M_Rig_SCENE_END_IthdOptAsml_TadpoleHandover to have mind flayer hand an apple/fruit/food to a starving child.

168.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the Flaming Fists catching sight of the mind flayer and attacks/pursues it. The mind flayer manages to escape and retreats back into the shadows. Fade back to campfire scene.

198.speaker: Lae'zel
198.text: |It's good to see you, old friend + additional nodes if needed for reactivity to the mindmeld of what the player mind flayer has been up to.|

160.speaker: Withers
160.text: Thou hast had quite the journey. And thou wilt - no doubt - have more.

234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Companions group around mind flayer / raise a glass to it / otherwise bond in communical activity.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: |It's good to see you, old friend + additional nodes if needed for reactivity to the mindmeld of what the player mind flayer has been up to.|

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: |It's good to see you, old friend + additional nodes if needed for reactivity to the mindmeld of what the player mind flayer has been up to.|

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: |It's good to see you, old friend + additional nodes if needed for reactivity to the mindmeld of what the player mind flayer has been up to.|

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

229.speaker: Wyll
229.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

171.speaker: Gale
171.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

46.speaker: Halsin
46.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

175.speaker: Minsc
175.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

95.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
95.text: |It's been a while... how have you been?|

81.speaker: Withers
81.text: Tell me, how hast thou fared?

90.speaker: Withers
90.text: Lae'zel - the githyanki warrior who became that which she despised to save a Prince, to save her people.

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

131.speaker: Wyll
131.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

204.speaker: Halsin
204.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

164.speaker: Jaheira
164.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

99.speaker: Minsc
99.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

231.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
231.text: |She really is the truest embodiment of her people's spirit.|

135.speaker: Withers
135.text: Her journey was quite surprising. To her more than to any other, I suspect.

77.speaker: Withers
77.text: I wonder how she is. And how she fares. But that, we may never know.

107.speaker: Withers
107.text: We would none of us be here without it.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: |I wonder what the Emperor's been up to?|

69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans away from the campfire scene to surrounding hedge/shrubbery, where a pair of mind flayer eyes loom out of the darkness.

174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to campfire: The mind flayer lets go of the branch that it was holding down to view the scene before it. The branch flicks up, the mind flayer obscured for good.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: |I wonder what the Emperor's been up to?|

17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
17.text: |I wonder what the Emperor's been up to?|

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: |At least he got what he deserved (had his head exploded by the brain OR been killed by us directly.|

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: |At least he got what he deserved (had his head exploded by the brain OR been killed by us directly.|

18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
18.text: |At least he got what he deserved (had his head exploded by the brain OR been killed by us directly.|

147.speaker: Player
147.text: She should be here with us.

150.speaker: Lae'zel
150.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

181.speaker: Gale

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

67.speaker: Jaheira
67.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

163.speaker: Minsc
163.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

57.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
57.text: |A travesty to have lost such a noble fighter|

240.speaker: Player
240.text: I hope the Hells are kinder to her than this plane has been.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

155.speaker: Wyll
155.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

230.speaker: Gale
230.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

78.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

184.speaker: Jaheira
184.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

191.speaker: Minsc
191.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
91.text: |She was a hell of a fighter - she'll be fine.|

1.speaker: Player
1.text: She knew she was dying, and chose to become an illithid so that we wouldn't have to.

251.speaker: Lae'zel
251.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

183.speaker: Wyll
183.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

177.speaker: Minsc
177.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

116.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
116.text: |She did good. Real good. It's not fair that she can't be here to reap the rewards, to live her life.|

179.speaker: Withers
179.text: Though he hath departed from our midst, he did not leave thee without one final word of parting.

248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers magically manifests hologram Gale.

193.speaker: GROUP_ORI_SoundsLikeGale
193.text: Well met! I am a magical projection of Gale of Waterdeep, and if you see this manifestation, that means I have prematurely perished.

208.speaker: GROUP_ORI_SoundsLikeGale
208.text: And this time, I'm sorry to say, there's no coming back.

33.speaker: GROUP_ORI_SoundsLikeGale
33.text: But no tears, friends. I hope that my sacrifice was meaningful - that the world is a safer place, and that you have found happiness.

53.speaker: GROUP_ORI_SoundsLikeGale
53.text: Truly, I wish I could be there with you.

213.speaker: GROUP_ORI_SoundsLikeGale
213.text: But now, I voyage elsewhere, on unknown currents, through unknown realms. One with the Weave. One with the infinite.
213.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hologram fades out into astral/Weave/infinite space.

70.speaker: Jaheira
70.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
34.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

192.speaker: Minsc
192.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: |How dare you speak ill of him! We owe him our lives.|

243.speaker: Withers
243.text: Thou would speak ill of one who made such sacrifice? Of one to whom thou owest thy life?

152.speaker: Withers
152.text: But after sacrifice comes rebirth. Tell me, what hast thou made of thyself?

224.speaker: Withers
224.text: But there is one among you who is missing...
